answers.Answer:
We accept the following forms of payment for rentals and purchases:

At the Box

1. Debit Cards
2. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover
3. Redbox Cards
4. MasterPass https://masterpass.com/en-us.html


On Demand

1. Debit Cards
2. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, or Discover


E-Gift Cards and Promo Codes

1. Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, or Discover
You'll find the 3-digit security code on the back of your Discover, Visa, or Mastercard. For American Express, the verification code is the 4 digits on the front of the card.

It’s Redbox policy not to refund charges that are older than 90 days.

If you have any questions, please contact the Customer Care team by visiting https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat

For each day you keep a rental, you'll be charged for another rental period + applicable tax.

If you hold onto your disc for the maximum rental period (in most areas, it's 17 days), you'll be charged the maximum charge and the disc is yours to keep.

We start the billing period once the reservation is confirmed.

It's important to pick up your rentals on the day you reserve them, you’ll be charged for that first night. For instance, if you reserve your movie online today, pick it up tomorrow, and return it the day after that, you’ll be charged for two nights. Your rentals will be held until 9 pm the day after you reserve them.

As soon as you swipe your card at the box, we'll authorize the transaction. If you used Masterpass online while making your reservation, the authorization occurs when the reservation is submitted.

The authorization appears as a pending charge on your bank or credit-card statement. It covers your first rental day, and will turn into a charge as soon as you return the last disc you rented during that transaction. For instance, if you rent two DVDs at $1.75 each, we'll hold $3.50 plus tax on your card until both discs are returned. If you rented the two discs on Monday and return one on Tuesday and the other on Wednesday, you're billed for both of them on Wednesday.

If you used a promo code or Redbox Perks points to rent the disc, your authorization hold will drop off within 3-5 days.
Federal copyright laws prohibit copying or burning rented material.

We accept credit and debit cards from Visa, Mastercard, American Express and Discover. If you used an accepted form of payment, we suggest following up with your bank or credit card customer service center as soon as possible to figure out why your card was declined.

answers.Summary: Charged twice for rental or purchase
answers.Answer:
Multiple charges may be the result of an authorization hold, which financial institutions sometimes take 3-5 days to release. It may also be for a partial payment collection if we were unable to collect the full balance at one time.

For Rentals - For any transaction involving a rental, you will see an immediate authorization for the one-night balance. The authorization is released when the discs are returned, then you are charged for the amount due based on the nights out. The authorization is released immediately, however your financial institution may take 3-5 days to process this. If you still have concerns, please contact Customer Care at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat

For Purchases - If you were billed multiple times for a disc that was purchased, please contact our Customer Care team to review the details of the transaction. Contact Customer Care at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat

For On Demand - If you were billed multiple times for an On Demand Transaction (Rental or Purchase), please contact our Customer Care team to review the details of the transaction. When using On Demand, be careful to complete the transaction only one time and not select Submit multiple times. Visit Customer Care at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat

After each transaction at the Box, your receipt will show the estimated points you've earned. After you return your rental and make a successful payment, your points will be added within 24-48 hours.

For On Demand, points move faster - and they'll be ready right after you make a successful payment. You can visit https://www.redbox.com/myperks to get a closer look at your points balance and earning history.

You can view the last 3 months of your transaction history after you've established an online profile with us. Transactions may take up to 48 hours to show up and will display for 90 days.

To view your trasaction history:

Web

1. Visit https://www.redbox.com/Account and login
2. Select the Transaction History tab to view your financial transactions.
3. You can check your rental history at https://www.redbox.com/Account/RentalHistory.

Mobile App

1. Launch the mobile app and login
2. Click on My Redbox
3. Click on the Person icon in the upper-left corner
4. Click on Transaction History

If you need additional help, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/chat

To view or make changes to your account, go to https://www.redbox.com/account and login, or use the Redbox mobile app. Within My Account, these are the things you can do:

Account Features

1. Account profile - includes attributes such as your birthday for rewards, your email address and password, and your payment methods
2. On Demand - device registrations and all of your notification preferences
3. Transaction History - for the last 90 days

Changing Account Information

Once logged in to your account, simply go to My Account - Settings in your web browser or go to My Redbox and tap the person icon at the top of your mobile app. From there you can modify the following information.

1. Profile - username, first & last name, address, and birthday
2. Sign In - email address and password
3. Payment Methods - credit card information
4. Promos & Offers - marketing preferences such as text club and emails.

If you've forgotten your password, or entered your password incorrectly 5-consecutive times initiating a 30-minute account lockout, you can reset the password. (If you entered your email address at a Redbox location and didn't set up an account through Redbox.com, you'll need to create a new account. You can create an account at https://www.redbox.com/account.)

Web Browser Password Reset

1. You can visit the Redbox Forgot Password page to request a temporary password. (The temporary password is valid for four hours.)
2. Once you have your temporary password, you can login.
3. The system will ask you change your temporary password immediately.*

Mobile App Password Reset

1. Select Forgot Password from the Redbox Sign In page.
2. Enter your email address and select Send Password.
3. Once you have your temporary password, you can login.
4. The system will ask you change your temporary password immediately.*


*Passwords must contain:

* 8 characters
* a number
* a lowercase letter
* an uppercase letter
* a special character (for example, @$%*#?&)

If this doesn't solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

To unsubscribe from our email list, click on the Unsubscribe link near the end of the email. This will unsubscribe you from newsletters. If you provide your email address during checkout, you'll still receive rental receipts.

Additional methods to unsubscribe from emails:

1. Online - Login to https://www.redbox.com and go to My Account - Settings, from here you can update your email notification preferences under Promos & Offers.

2. Mobile app - Go to My Account - Promos & Offers and update your email notification preferences.

You can easily remove a payment card from your account. Follow the steps below depending on the type of device you're using:

Deleting a Payment Card from the Web

1. Login to your account by visiting https://www.redbox.com/account.
2. Access My Accounts - Settings.
3. Scroll to find Payment Methods.
4. Select the Edit or the pencil icon for the payment card.
5. Select Remove.

Deleting a Payment Card from the Mobile App

1. Access the Redbox App.
2. Select My Redbox.
3. Select the Person icon in the upper left-hand corner.
4. Select Payment Method.
5. Select the card to remove.
6. Select Remove

Deleting an E-Gift Card

E-Gift Cards can't be deleted from https://www.redbox.com accounts.

If you need additional help, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

Redbox Perks is our loyalty program. It's a fun and rewarding way to score free rentals and perks from Redbox. To sign-up, visit https://www.redbox.com/redboxperks. Here's how the program works:

Earning Points

Members can earn points in the program by completing qualifying activities such as renting a movie or celebrating a birthday. For more information on earning points, visit https://www.redbox.com/redboxperks/terms


Badges

Take on fun challenges and earn serious bragging rights. Visit https://www.redbox.com/account/perksinfo#perksbadges to learn more about earning Badges within the Perks program.


Redeeming Points

You can start redeeming free stuff as soon as you have at least 1,500 points.

1. To redeem your points at the Box, just sign in to Redbox Perks and select the Use Points button.
2. You can also go to https://www.redbox.com, or the mobile app, to use points to make an online reservation.


Checking your Status Level

The Program offers four levels of status: Perks, Star, Superstar, and Legend. For more information on these levels, visit https://www.redbox.com/redboxperks/terms.

Your status level is determined by the amount of discs rented, purchased etc. For example, if you have 3 discs in one transaction, your counter will increase by 3 toward the next status level.

In the Perks program, your points will expire 12 months from the date of earning them. The 12-month time period will begin on the date you completed the transaction (not the date the points appear in your account).

On another note, all of your points will expire after 6 months of account inactivity.

Here are some ways to make sure you stay active:

1. Rent a DVD, Blu-Ray or 4K UHD Disc.
2. Purchase a movie at the Box
3. Make an On Demand transaction

You can go to https://www.redbox.com/myperks to get a closer look at your points balance and earning history.

That's easy - here's a look at our qualifying transactions within the Perks program:

1. Rent a DVD, Blu-Ray or 4K UHD Disc.
2. Purchase a movie at the Box
3. Make an On Demand transaction

These qualifying transactions are only complete once you make a successful payment (if applicable). Each disc is counted separately toward your status levels even thought they may be part of the same transaction. For example, you rent 2 discs under one transaction, your counter will increase by 2.

In the Perks program, once you reach a level, you'll be in it for the remainder of that year - plus the next year! For example, if you become a Superstar in March of this year, you'll be at least a Superstar for the rest of this year and all of next year. If you keep renting and purchasing enought to mecome a Legend during this time, you'll level up and be a Legend for the rest of that year and the next. Visit https://www.redbox.com/perks and scroll down the page to learn more about the different levels in the program.

Badges are part of the Perks program that can be earned for any activity. Badges are awesome to earn on their own, but Superstars and Legends also get points per earned badge.

1. Superstars: 50 points per badge
2. Legends: 100 points per badge

Visit https://www.redbox.com/perks and scroll to the More Ways To Earn section to learn more about Badges.

category.cat: Charged twice for rental or purchase
